summary: This document is an email from Jeffrey Epstein to Jes Staley, forwarding information about new hires at UBS Private Bank. The email discusses the appointments of Alexander Friedman, Mona Sutphen, and Mark Haefele, highlighting UBS's efforts to strengthen its private banking division following previous financial challenges.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the sender of the email, sharing information about UBS's new hires.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is the recipient of the email from Epstein.

persons.name: Boris Nikolic
persons.context: Nikolic is mentioned as the original sender of the forwarded message regarding UBS's new hires.

persons.name: Alexander Friedman
persons.context: Friedman is named as the new chief investment officer at UBS Private Bank.

persons.name: Mona Sutphen
persons.context: Sutphen is mentioned as a new hire at UBS, formerly a managing director at Stonebridge International LLC.

persons.name: Mark Haefele
persons.context: Haefele is mentioned as a new hire at UBS, co-founder of The Sonic Funds.

persons.name: Katharina Bart
persons.context: Bart is mentioned as the author of the article regarding UBS's new hires.

keyFacts: The email discusses new hires at UBS Private Bank, including Alexander Friedman, Mona Sutphen, and Mark Haefele.
UBS is attempting to strengthen its private banking division after previous financial challenges.
The document contains a confidentiality notice indicating it may be attorney-client privileged.
Epstein's email indicates a personal or professional relationship with Jes Staley.
The email was sent on February 28, 2011.
